title: Four people injured in Feltonville shooting
content:
A shooting in the Feltonville section of Philadelphia wounded at least four people early Saturday.
The shooting took place about 5:20 a.m. along the 4200 block of Macalester Street, according to preliminary information from Philadelphia police. A 22-year-old woman was shot in her left foot; another woman, also 22, was shot in her left arm, police said.
Officers rushed both victims to Temple University Hospital, where they were placed in stable condition.
A 21-year-old man suffered a graze wound to his head and was taken by private vehicle to Temple University Episcopal Hospital, police said. He was listed in stable condition.
A fourth victim later arrived at Cooper University Hospital in Camden, New Jersey, police said. That person’s condition was unclear. The car used to transport the victim was held for investigation, and Philadelphia police detectives were headed to the hospital.
There wasn't word on a suspect or suspects, and additional details about the circumstances surrounding the shooting weren't immediately available. No arrest had been reported, as of Saturday afternoon.
Anyone with information was asked to contact Philadelphia police.
